result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khamani Allijah Meeks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks not in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas Harris appears video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Harris has been appointed. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks appeared by video, in custody in CDC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Khamani Allijah Meeks in custody at CDC.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Khamani Allijah Meeks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
